item.title: Criminal activity taking place because safer neighborhood police sitting on benches all day. Taxpayers money well spent, 9th September

item.title: Insufficient traffic lights, 9th September
item.description:
The last 2 weeks I have started walking my two children to the school and station. Several times already I have seen cars passing through a red light on this pedestrian crossing. The issue is that once the cars pass through the red traffic light (marked with a red line on the attached photo) there is nothing to indicate that they need to stop for the pedastian crossing. There needs to be a traffic light ON the pedestrian crossing (marked with a red circle on attached photo) AND yellow hatchings which prevent them from queueing between the existing traffic light and the pedestrian crossing. On one the occasion a van was stopped in the nearest lane and it hid us from the waiting cars and we did not see the cars put their foot down on the otherside of the van. They came passed the van at some speed just as we had stepped out (our pedestrain light was green). If we had come out passed the van we would have been hit. This is a crossing commonly ussed by children lots of whom are travelling alone (yesr 6 and secondary school). Bickley park school is opposite the crossing and bickley station is round the corner.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Page Heath Lane, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet
